Quote: Better be proficient in one art than a smatter in a hundred.
Author: Japanese proverb

Quote: The absent are never without fault. Nor the present without excuse.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: Out of sight, out of mind.
Author: Homer

Quote: Deliberate with caution, but act with decision; and yield with graciousness, or oppose with firmness.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: The great end of life is not knowledge, but action.
Author: T. H. Huxley

Quote: Actions speak louder than words.
Author: Proverb

Quote: We would often be ashamed of our finest actions if the world understood all the motives which produced them.
Author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

Quote: Things won are done, joy's soul lies in the doing.
Author: Shakespeare

Quote: A rolling stone can gather no moss.
Author: Pubilius Syrus

Quote: It is attempting to reach the top at a single leap, that so much misery is caused in the world.
Author: William Cobbett

Quote: Ambition and  suspicion always go together.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

Quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled by great ambitions.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Ambition is a vice, but it may be the father of virtue.
Author: Quintilian

Quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.
Author: Shakespeare

Quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance; the virtue of adversity is fortitude.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
Author: George Gordon, Lord Byron

Quote: Trial is the true test of mortal men.
Author: Pindar

Quote: Of one ill comes many.
Author: Scottish proverb

Quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity, which like the toad, ugle and venomous, wears yet a precious jewel in his head.
Author: Shakespeare

Quote: Anger begins with folly and ends with repentance.
Author: Henry George Bohn, Pythagoras

Quote: Truly to moderate your mind and speech when you are angry, or else to hold your peace, betokens no ordinary nature.
Author: Cicero

Quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.
Author: John Dryden

Quote: The best answer to anger is silence.
Author: German proverb

Quote: A soft answer turneth away wrath; but the grievous words stir up anger.
Author: Proverbs 15:1

Quote: He best keeps from anger who remembers that God is always looking upon him.
Author: Plato

Quote: There's something wrong, or missing, with any person who hasn't  got a soft spot in their heart for an animal of some kind.
Author: Will James

Quote: In life beauty perishes, but not in art.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci
